spans.text: Acceptance Test (AT) Environment Guidelines

lines.text: The Acceptance Test (AT) environment was established for the following

spans.text: The Acceptance Test (AT) environment was established for the following

lines.text: purposes:

spans.text: purposes:

lines.text: Acceptance/ Performance testing of forms and functionality prior to

lines.text: Primary Use

spans.text: Primary Use

lines.text: The primary use of AT is for the Grants.gov team to test changes to the

spans.text: The primary use of AT is for the Grants.gov team to test changes to the

lines.text: Grants.gov system before deploying them into the production environment.

spans.text: Grants.gov system before deploying them into the production environment.

lines.text: Therefore, agencies and applicants are asked to follow these guidelines so that

spans.text: Therefore, agencies and applicants are asked to follow these guidelines so that

lines.text: the AT environment is able to handle all of these activities without jeopardizing its

spans.text: the AT environment is able to handle all of these activities without jeopardizing its

lines.text: primary function as the Grants.gov internal test system. In addition, following

spans.text: primary function as the Grants.gov internal test system. In addition, following

lines.text: these guidelines will help ensure that agency and applicant users of AT will be

spans.text: these guidelines will help ensure that agency and applicant users of AT will be

lines.text: able to use the system in the most equitable manner possible.

spans.text: able to use the system in the most equitable manner possible.

lines.text: Load Testing

spans.text: Load Testing

lines.text: Load testing is not permitted in the AT environment. The AT system is not built to

spans.text: Load testing is not permitted in the AT environment. The AT system is not built to

lines.text: handle the volume of applications that production does. Please keep your daily

spans.text: handle the volume of applications that production does. Please keep your daily

lines.text: number of submissions to a “reasonable” limited number that are of average-

spans.text: number of submissions to a “reasonable” limited number that are of average-

lines.text: sized applications.

spans.text: sized applications.

lines.text: Peak Usage Time

spans.text: Peak Usage Time

lines.text: Peak usage times of AT tend to be from Monday through Friday from 10:00 a.m.

spans.text: Peak usage times of AT tend to be from Monday through Friday from 10:00 a.m.

lines.text: to 3:30 p.m. Eastern Time. Delays in processing times and unexpected

spans.text: to 3:30 p.m. Eastern Time. Delays in processing times and unexpected

lines.text: downtimes are more likely to occur during these times. Please plan your testing

spans.text: downtimes are more likely to occur during these times. Please plan your testing

lines.text: accordingly.

spans.text: accordingly.

lines.text: Restrictions of Use

spans.text: Restrictions of Use

lines.text: As the use of AT grows, Grants.gov may find it necessary to restrict the use of

spans.text: As the use of AT grows, Grants.gov may find it necessary to restrict the use of

lines.text: AT and schedule the use of AT by agencies and applicants. However, to date,

spans.text: AT and schedule the use of AT by agencies and applicants. However, to date,

lines.text: we have had a great deal of cooperation regarding the use of the testing

spans.text: we have had a great deal of cooperation regarding the use of the testing

lines.text: completed by both the applicant and agency community on AT. We wish for this

spans.text: completed by both the applicant and agency community on AT. We wish for this
